review_title: Consequences are what sets it apart. A radical, yet fun superhero tale, but unfortunately packaged in a generic wrapper.
If Professor X made a baby with Magneto and dressed him up with a cheap aluminium suit, there you have the villain.

review_detailed_main: Hrithik looks ravishing, and really super cool as the Indian version of a super hero. One who is suave, macho, dripping with strength and charisma and can give Supermans, Batmans and Ironmans of this world a run for their money. In the third edition of the saga, 'Krissh 3' attempts to break the technological barriers that our movie industry faced with large scale action sequences. 'Krrish 3' has all the elements of an entertainer and a lot of potential to have given some serious competition to Hollywood flicks. One can't really complain about a somewhat predictable plot (after all superhero movies are supposed to be about the triumph of good over evil). He also makes the action and the fights look natural. He may not be the most gifted actor but he pulls off both Rohit and Krishna well. Priyanka Chopra looks pretty as the 'wife' and doesn't have much to do.The background score by Salim and Suleiman is good and follows the moods well, Over all best super hero movie till date in India, this movie can be compared to any super hero film from Hollywood because it deserves .

The reason behind why BOLLYWOOD is way behind in producing high-octane-intense-action-packed-superhero movie is that they lack the guts of making a great cinema. They often have spoiled it by bollywoodising it. Drona lacked the content or rather I'd say it lacked everything. Ra.One was excruciatingly funny. These movies suffered with the idea of doing so many things at a time. A large amount of melodrama and unwanted commercial breaks in the form of songs diluted the whole tension and ultimately the movie came out as a comedy of errors.But the one movie which still stands tall as an epitome of Superhero-Entertainment from India was Robot(Enthiran) which had great special effects providing the heart of this genre an edge.

Krrish3 suffers from many of these problems which sometimes is really interesting but the melodrama and the songs which are a total letdown makes it dull.But ask me, how is it in terms of action, special effects and CGI? My answer: Don't know how they pulled it off but as far as Special Effects, Action and CGI are concerned this is the best from India hands down. Krrish3 is a helluva movie when it means business. You start praying when your Superhero Krrish starts fighting against the evil and saves the world. Watch out for that sequence when Krrish saves all the passenger of an aeroplane and many more in the climax.Rakesh Roshan has made this movie with two minds. Sometimes he makes a fool out of you but then there are really some edge of the seat sequences.But the balance made by him between the emotional(only in some parts) and the action sequences is worth appreciating.

If you need the audience to cheer for their hero when he fights against the evil then that hero's portrayal should be worth it. We have heard actors playing double roles but here Hrithik Roshan is playing three roles at a time and then after watching if you still feel there is a difference of feel in each of the three(Rohit Mehra,Krishna and Krrish),it really is an achievement. Of all the three Rohit Mehra(the one with the tummy) is the pick of the lot with his Koi... Mil Gaya's childishness and Krrishna(the one with 8 packs) having not much of scope is acceptable with his handsome hunk looks. But the real difficulty for him would have been in playing Krrish's role where his green eyes had to do the talking and believe me it did.Jr. Roshan and Special Effects are the USP of the film.Priyanka Chopra and Kangana Ranaut are believable. And lastly Vivek Oberoi (Kaal) which is sometimes exemplary and unintentionally funny both.

Rajesh Roshan's music and the lyrics is a total letdown in this movie. I don't get the reason behind the presence of the songs in this movie. And that too Raghupati Raghav(you can tolerate as Hrithik pumps up the floor in this one to save you) ,God Allah aur Bhagwan and Dil Tu Hi Bata. I am still recovering. But talk about the background score Salim-Sulaiman has done a blinder in K3.

If Sr. Roshan wanted he could have made a great movie by avoiding the roona-dhona and songs but overall this movie will be popcorn-entertainment for some and an average for others. I recommend you go watch this Diwali Blockbuster once to celebrate our entry into the Special Effects arena at the international level.

P.S: I enjoyed this one very much as compared to the previous two releases we had in Diwali.

3/5

What the hell is wrong with Industry.. why don't they are using their own mind. why just doing copy paste stuff.! Krishh 3 a Hindi version of XMEN Series. I like Koi.. Mil Gaya.. Krish was also good but. Krish 3. Well, 1 thing which 1 like was the animation.! nice effort like it.. but the story waste the animations efforts. Such a big budget movie and story like this. why don't they concentrate on script and choreography. Krish3 is just a waste of time and money. Don't like it.

3/10 rating just for the animations. The story is more action based than character.

Personally i don't like it but it wasn't a big issue. I am just thinking that was it a Xmen 3rd class copy. I don't understand why they copied every character of Xmen and Why Hrithik got all the power of each XMEN superstar.?

Well, go check it out. for the animation factor. a good science fiction effort but a bad story and script.!

review_title: so much potential and yet this movie was so horrible
review_detailed_main: There is no story at all.. If the director would have got a decent script and executed it this movie and franchise could have become great.. but instead we are served with a horrible mixture of every Hollywood super hero movie made.. and by that i mean pick ANY Hollywood superhero movie and you will find at least one scene from it in krrish 3.. Even the dialogues have been picked from the enlist movies and blatantly translated to Hindi without regard to how ridiculous they sound.. Its a shame that the first real Indian superhero is nothing but a lame caricature. Rakesh roshan should stop direct these movies and get a more able and serious director, as he's the producer anyway he ll make all the money , but at least the audience gets a good movie.

review_title: This movie couldn't be more stupid.

review_detailed_main:
To be honest, it was good. Much better than expected. Great visual effects.

Good work by Hrithik in both the roles. Priyanka got a small screen space. But Kangana surprised. Good work from her as well. As I told this was better than expected and I enjoyed. First half of the movie was very fast paced and happening which made me feel interval come a tad too early. Second half has more action and some more songs. Except raghupati raghav one none were good.

Only let down was more than necessary songs. Also in some places the background track was scary and felt weird.

If ignored above two points ( which I did) this is a great movie, good for kids. And acceptable Indian Superhero :) From the credits, the animation and special effects team was Indian. Kudos team.

Also the movie ends with potential of Krrish 4 Would wait for that.

review_title: The good, the bad and the worse.
review_detailed_main:
Okay so I'm gonna get to the point.

The Good- The good part about this movie is Hrithik Roshan because he makes Krrish believable. He actually does look like a super hero so that's a plus and i must admit Krrish is more believable than Ra-One. Also, The movie is entertaining at times and will make you laugh a little in a good way. And at last, the action in this movie is really good. It is enjoyable to see Krrish beast up the baddies.

The Bad- The bad part about this movie is that if you have seen any of the Hollywood superhero movies (like me) you will not enjoy this movie because honestly they are much, MUCH better. In Krrish 3 there is no character development and Krrish's strength depends on how much drama is going on in the movie for example he helps lift a plane but he has hard time lifting up a simple truck.. please tell me what kind of logic is that?

The Worse- It makes me so mad that the costume designers could not come up with a better costume for Kaal. He looks like he went to the junkyard and put scrap pieces on himself after polishing them. Also his super power origins is so ridiculous you'll see what I'm talking about. The story is weak and oh so disappointing music, I was expecting much more from Rajesh Roshan. And last thing, When Krrish jumps super high and lands on a building it looks so fake even for super hero standards and that is saying a lot.

Overall- ONLY FOR KIDS.

review_title: Out & Out Desi Action - Aventure, Drama and Futuristic Extravaganza.
review_detailed_main: Well most of the people are friendly with the names Batman, Superman, Iron Man, Spiderman etc. these characters have a legacy of more than 70 years, everybody knows who they are, what they do, powers, weaknesses etc. So it is much easier to make a movie on them when you already have so much references and specific guidelines. On the other hand in India people do know about Dhruva, Doga, Parmanu and others, But In Krrish-3 Rakesh Roshan has tried to establish a fresh new Superhero, and he deserves an applause for that. In my knowledge there must be one thousand superheroes are living on earth. So little similarity to each other is acceptable. The biggest threat for a superhero film is his audience, In India people don't accept much change easily and as a filmmaker 'Rakesh had to educate his audience'. I must say he did a splendid job. Acting wise Hrithik, Vivek and surprisingly Kangana have done justice with their characters. Priyanka looked the girl next door and did a fare job. Story and screenplay holds you well till the end, Vfx and Action scenes are good enough for everyone. Fight Sequences between 'Krrish and his enemies are marvelous', specially the war with KAAL. Vivek looked 'furious' and Sinister. Character of Rohit is the film's stronghold. Dialogues could be better at some places. Some scenes could be removed but that's an editor's fault. Films biggest back draw is its songs and background score. All in all Krrish is a family delight which you can enjoy with kids and parents.

Rakesh roshan has taken great risk while making such a huge movie.. and from God's grace it went well for the whole entire industry.. The movie is really entertaining with its content and Hritik roshan's splendid performance..Hats off to Rakesh Roshan who is fit for making Hollywood budget film according to Indian fans. the movie has made a new milestone in Indian Cinema...must watch movie...However I must admit that Krish 2 was fantastic as it had good engaging story right from starting to the end.We indians understand that in our country making Sci-fiction movie is really difficult as we have no qualified technicians, writers and good budget.. That is why we rely on Hollywood for watching good sci-fiction movies

PROS

Initially my expectation were quite low as the trailer seemed like X- Men, Spiderman and Man of Steel. The movie exceeded my expectations in case of the basic plot. The basic story is not a rip off of any movie and neither are the character's motivations(except their powers are similar to X-Men characters, but that's forgivable). This movie is much much better than Ra.one when it comes to the storyline(though Ra.one and Robot had better special effects). The purely Indian vfx did what they could do with a meager budget(in comparison to Hollywood films) and without help from Hollywood. The special effects are impressive by Indian standards. And I commend the director to try and make such a movie. The final fight scene is impressive by Indian Standard( though it seems like Man of Steel with cheap special effects)

CONS

In spite of a decent plot, the movie makes a mess presenting it as the plot drags for 2 hours and 30 minutes with ridiculous songs and cheesy clichés. One thing I hated about this movie is the way it tried to show the concept of Krrish as a symbol(like Batman). While in Dark Knight Rises the anyone can be Batman concept and the unveiling of Batman's statue seemed epic. In Krrish something similar happens with a minister unveiling Krrish's statue. But instead of feeling epic like in Dark Knight Rises this scene is cheesy and laughable as this scene is the premise to that ridiculous Bhagwan Allah song, so you can see Krrish dancing in front of his own statue. Also the concept of anyone can be Krrish(Batman) is shown as a kiddy concept somewhat similar to how Shaktiman gives moral values to kids. The special effects seem like a video-game cut-scene(can be forgiven).

In the age of Dark and gritty superheroes this movie basically is made for kids aged 4-13. I would have loved this movie if it came 6-7 years ago. Minus the songs I would have rated it 6/10(me being lenient) and minus the whole Krrish is a symbol subplot and I would have rated it 7- 7.5/10 but the movie as a whole is average

review_title: Even if you heard people say, 'this one copies work from many sources', the movie is actually very good!
As one who has little experience with Bollywood action movie or the Krissh series, I wouldn't recommend Krrish 3 because it's too clichéd, too over-the-top, and too long.
Dosent even deserve 1 star if it was an object I would spit on it
Desi Version of Superman, Spiderman and X-Men
review_detailed_main:
The third movie of the 2003 Koi Mil Gaya series where we had Krish in 2006 and now after a long gap we have krish 3 of which Krish 2 is still missing. Just keeping the title confusion apart let us see what does the film delivers the audience. Krish 3 does a lot to entertain you especially kids but seems lacking originality in the script. On the story line it is nothing new what we see is parts and portions directly lifted up from some of the famous Super Hero movies in Hollywood like Superman, Spidermen and X-Men series. On the whole it's the shudh Desi version of superman and spiderman. But at the same time looking at the efforts made on producing good visual effects on screen we should say Krish 3 stands NO 1 in the Indian Super hero movie series like Endhiran (The Robot), Raw-one, previous Krish . So we can say its sure making well in Box office in India than a worldwide hit collection pertaining to the fact that bollywood didn't have any competitive release this Diwali. Coming to the cast we have got Hritik Roshan in the lead as the Super hero Krish, Krishna and the intelligent Rohit Mehra he has done his part clearly. I don't know what compelled Miss Chopra to be a part of this script because she didn't have much screen space except for the fact that she becomes the carrier for the Krish 4 franchise with her pregnancy. Kangana as Kaya-the chameleon temptress which is exactly the mystique from X-Men series has done a good job fitting perfectly to the skinny Latex outfit and the role as well. Vivek oberoi as Kaal the antagonist (again Prof X from X-Men) was OK in his character because he shows up more action towards the end and where most of the anti-role was done by Kangana. Coming to technical part VFX was the best in the movie and Music as well as BGM was below average. Director has worked hard in mostly quizzing the viewers to name the original movie in each scene.

Verdict: Apart from all positive and negative things criticized here I would rate 3/5 because it doesn't stop entertaining you and for the effort to show something equivalent to World cinema. But strictly for fantasy movie lovers (if you see this movie as an Indian fantasy and strictly not comparing it with Hollywood's super hero movies). Especially kids Diwali treat.

-Reviewed by Sivakumar Balachandran (bsiva84@gmail.com)

The cast and crew of Krrish 3 may look at this movie as milestone in Indian cinema however, it turned out to be "A SLAP ON YOUR FACE". A completely illogical and stolen content from Hollywood superhero movie I have ever seen in my life. I must hand it to the entire team for making my decision strong about not wasting my money and watching Bollywood movies anymore. If you give the audience something crappy like this, at least have the decency to back it up with LOGIC.

The list of everything bad about this movie is so long that you could actually write a book about it which will actually be more entertaining than the movie. Enough said, it was an AWFUL movie and if you want to waste your money and time watching it, God Bless You then!

review_title: Best Bollywood Action FiIm Ever Made
review_detailed_main: Great acting, great star-cast, great story, spectacular action, breathtaking VFX, crappy music. Overall a more that decent film for the movie lovers. Respect for Mr.Rakesh Roshan for making such a huge film in a small budget of (!4 Million + 3 million for promotions. Hrithik has done it again. Both Kangna and Priyanka did a decent job. Vivek oberoi has made kaal's character more interesting but was quite disappointed with his poorly designed costume. Other mutants were just OK. Visuals are just awesome and did setup a high standard for an Bollywood. The only drawback of this movie is its irritating songs and felt that Rajesh Roshan was forced to score the music for this film. Overall really enjoyed it. Now waiting for the DVD release. Happy Diwali Everyone :)

I was skeptical before watching this movie because after watching so many near-to-perfect Hollywood superhero movies I wasn't sure if I would like this one. But I must say it didn't disappoint.

The story is good but not flawless, it does not bore but seems a little too lengthy and draggy in the middle. Music section is a little disappointing, no complaints with the background music though. Anyhow, I don't get the point of songs in a superhero movie. They slow down the pace of a fairly speedy movie. But let's not forget it's a Bollywood movie after all. Same excuse goes to all the emotional dialogues about love, strength, victory of good over evil etc. I think that the audience goes prepared for a little drama for a Bollywood(masala) movie. Hrithik's appearance as 'Rohit Mehra' is really nice. It reminds of the same old kiddo in 'Koi Mil Gaya'. Hrithik Roshan is a very talented actor and dancer, he has proved it yet again . Vivek Oberoi and Kangana Ranaut have also done justice to their roles. They have acted too well. Priyanka Chopra has not been given a strong role. The action sequences are good. The visual effects are too good in the movie and the movie could be watched just for those(and hey come on for once let's not compare them to Hollywood).

All in all a good movie, not worth missing. If u keep your expectations a little low you'll love the movie.

Overall rating: 6.5/10

This movie doesn't seems to have anything original.

In this series, Koi Mil Gaya was the best movie. Then Krrish was only acceptable, not that good though, but now this. Come on. This movie doesn't felt like something special.

I wonder, how this movie earned so much !! Its not worth that amount.

At least for me, it felt worst. So, 1 star for that.

Plus, I think the Roshan Family have no more good ideas for new film. That's why they are even talking about Krrish 4. I am not gonna watch any more movies of Hrithik. I think, he is losing his abilities day by day.

The Universe is responding. Krrish 3 movie is a treat to watch. 1stly, it is a clean movie which is rarely seen in today's time. So you can enjoy the movie with your family. It is not like other big budget movies which are hyped by marketing strategy and goes bust after the release. It has good story and well edited which binds the movie till end. Technology has been used brilliantly with the story and looks very realistic. Rakesh Roshan deserves credit for brilliant story, movie and doing something out of box for Indian cinema. There are several WOW moments in the movie. On the negative side I feel that songs would have been completely avoided. It causes interruption to the interesting story. Hrithik has acted brilliantly and so has Vivek Oberoi done justice to his role. I would recommend all to watch this movie and have a great time with friends and family. It deserve 10 out of 10.

Koi Mil Gaya was a genuine flick and Krrish was somewhat successful to continue Rohit and his son Krishna's life saga. But Krrish 3 is all about the smashing stunning scenes and all the conflict between Krrish and Kaal.

It starts on a rather sweet note where we see our protagonist having a simple life with her wife who is pregnant and his father who he brought back from the dead in the previous installment of the series. But then the plot starts shifting towards the villain and his plans of demolishing the world just so he can rule.

One thing I must appreciate is Rakesh Roshan's genuine direction that we saw in the previous installments and the special effects that amuse the viewers throughout the film. But the screenplay is too botched up because of so many writers stepping in. But the movie follows a pretty simple narrative in the first half and an unneeded love angle in the another. And many characters are added which makes the character development worse just for more conflict for Krrish.

Some of these desi elements work but some doesn't. It may not be as good the previous installments but a step ahead for Indian cinema and is worth a watch.

review_title: The Possibility Of Krrish 5 Appalls Me. ♦ 46%
review_detailed_main:
I say that because not only has the Krrish sequels obliterated the standalone success of "Koi... Mil Gaya," but also has been wrongly termed an epitome of modern superhero trend of Bollywood.

The best thing about Krrish 3, if at all you consider, is the cast & their performance: Hrithik Roshan is very fine, but Kangana Ranaut will amaze you more. Priyanka Chopra, Vivek Oberoi & supporting cast follow the director's words. With a flashback on how the story had unfolded till now, the film starts with great promise and ambitious setup. What was supposed to be a lean, solid sci-fiction action movie turned out to be a copy of Hollywood films & clichés as the villain(s) enter(s) the scene. Tad unpredictability keeps the show going without inducing boredom and with random songs & brand advertisements & good Samaritan sub-stories, the film manages to flow. Involving Science into the script was one more good thing the makers did.

The popular X-Men franchise has been heavily sampled here, of course with direct references. Not to mention, almost every scene has something from Star Wars & Star Trek (dialogs), Inception (music), Avengers (stunts) & Batman series (costumes). If a person hasn't relished Hollywood in their palates, Krrish 3 will be a 7/10. But, unfortunately even kids nowadays have experienced the H'wood wind, so a 4.6/10 is quite generous.

And about the much-talked CGI, SFX, AFX, VFX: well, they are not bad at all. Since Indian cinema is trying very hard at it, we as audience should respect the effort and with Krrish 3, it gains applause. Few elements like the virus outbreak, theism/atheism and other baloney just works against the story which is, hands down, for 9 year old kids. And the climax makes me ask a question: Will there be a Krrish 5, like we didn't have Krrish 2? And if they are to walk in the same path, I'd be damned.

BOTTOM LINE: Faintly Recommended! Come on now, people! Spare the prejudice and consider: Is your child a fan? YES? Go for it! If you are bored this weekend, go catch "Gravity" (2013) or "Captain Phillips" (2013)!

One thing is sure, BOLLYWOOD in this decade still gasps for filmmaking instincts. It is high time they should inculcate indigenousness if they are to adopt such top-level genres.

Krish did not meet the expectation set at all. Half of the story revolved around the characters of X-Men, with horrible songs. This would explain why no songs were promoted in the trailer. The antagonist was a hybrid of professor X, Magneto and a Football player with the power of Jean Grey.

The first movie had a plot, the second had action, but Krish 3 had nothing original or anything worth talking about. But, one thing is for sure, Krish 3 beats the hell out of Ra-One (which gets -9.5) in my books.

Watch Krish if you have absolutely nothing better to do with your life or if you have lots of money to waste.

review_title: When will we learn to make movies
review_detailed_main:
I caught up with Krishh 3 after a bit of struggle with my inner conscience. I mean I didn't wanted to watch the movie but couldn't help it as I had enough time to kill. Ironically, I chose to watch it just after Gravity which shows that Hollywood is light-years ahead of us in terms of direction, acting, cinematography and plot.

Sadly I slept most of the half after interval, still Krishh 3 seems to be a valiant effort in Indian Cinema to serve Indian public a taste of Sci-Fi. Had the characters not been imitated from erstwhile Hollywood movies, it would have fared better in minds of good Cinema lovers. But the characters and scenes are reminiscent of roles played in movies such as X-Men, Matrix, and list goes on....

Hrithik Roshan surprisingly fails to inspire and disappoints. Kangana Ranaut does add some substance to the movie, is awesomely beautiful and outshines Priyanka Chopra is every front, be it acting, appearance or screen presence. There are 1 or 2 good music scores in the movie, but in totality we still lack in making a proper subject movie.

review_title: KRRISH-3 is only a pastiche of Movies blended with Indian masala.
review_detailed_main:
Okay the wait is finally over.Got a chance to see this highly awaited movie of the year. What did I get? A patch of X-men, A name (KAAL) from "Man of steel", VFX similar to Avengers, X-men, Man of steel, Terminator series, All this blended with Songs and Dance numbers, comedy etc etc essential ingredients for a typical Indian Movie. Talent wasted, hair line plot, brand and merchandise promotion, OMG what was Rakesh Roshan thinking when he remarked that this movie will earn " Rs 1000 crore" business in BO? Well the only remarkable thing this movie showed to whole world is that India can now produce Movies like Hollywood. That's it...

Let's see If "DHOOM-3" can make a real DHOOMMMMMM....

review_title: A superhero film that no one can beat!
review_detailed_main:
There aren't enough words to praise the work put into this film by Rakesh Roshan and Hrithik Roshan. Firstly let's start with the direction which is absolutely fantastic. I wouldn't say it's flawless, but the power packed performances make it flawless. The special effects are out of this world, and something that Hollywood will be very proud of! Superman and Batman are films that as kids, we love and remember to date but Krrish will go down in the Indian folk law as one of those films for all Indian kids (and adults). I love how this is a superhero film from start to finish, and that is exactly what it should be!

Huge credit must go to Salim-Sulaiman for their background music - when seeing Hrithik up in your face on the big screen, it's their thumping beats that make you sit up and feel that you are part of this fight Krrish is battling! Hats off! It's a shame that Rajesh Roshan's music didn't quite match up to the background music otherwise it would have been even better!

Now to the performances and of course Krrish 3 is Hrithik's film and there is no doubt about that. Priyanka does well in her role but the scope is clearly left for Kangna who does a fantastic job. Not only does she speak clearly compared to normal, but she looks stunning on screen! Vivek Oberoi is fantastic as Kaal and will certainly be in contention for best villain award. His dialogue delivery, stature and presence on screen clearly shows that he is still a very good actor! Back to Hrithik, and it would be a shame for me to leave without talking more about him. It's hard enough to do a double role, but when throughout the film you play father and son, it's on another level the way he does it. He brings out the magic of Krrish, but also reminds you of Koi Mil Gaya and the innocence of Rohit when playing the father. Awards won't be enough for this man!

Overall Krrish 3 is the best film of the year, so far! And will certainly win many awards. We have a new superhero now and Krrish is here to stay. I can't wait for them to make the next one!

review_title: The long awaited film KRRISH 3 should be the perfect conclusion to the KRRISH series.
review_detailed_main: Though after watching the action sequences of KRRISH, I overestimated about the next part of KRRISH, but after watching KRRISH 3 I realized how much of my hope left unfulfilled. Yes there are some very good action sequences in this film with well-developed CGI technology and VFX effects, some good parts were there for sure: but the plot was not very convincing, and the worst part is the adaptation of X-MEN franchise, i.e. some villain characters similar to the X-MEN franchise. It felt to me more like I'm watching a X-MEN film in which KRRISH is the only protagonist. Another worst part was some details, to outburst our emotion, held at the very moment it was needed to. Like should the baby really necessary to be there when the building was falling apart,which KRRISH was lifting. It made me feel like "What a plotting..!! :D ". Those were, from my point of view, some exaggerations, which were not needed and also some very bad dialogues of the antagonist 'Kaal'; instead if the plot was given a bit strength, then I would not be writing this review like this. Still I prefer Indian cinema needs brand new superb ideas from this 'Gen Y' to make a super hero film. Now one thing I must admit overall, that the acting of every cast was pretty good. If I found myself to breath fresh throughout the movie, then that was because of the acting. And as for Hrithik Roshan as playing both the roles of Krishna Mehra i.e. KRRISH and his father Rohit Mehra side by side is outstanding; Kangna Ranaut as a female figure, accomplice of Evil, but still believer in Good is fabulous and also well praised. Now I am not saying that KRRISH 3 is entirely rubbish, because it is not; it is a far better movie than 'Ra.One' or 'Drona' or even 'Robot'. Frankly, the KRRISH series has its own state of entity, and I must admit that KRRISH 3 has been made within it. After watching the trailer, I, from myself, thought that, watching KRRISH 3 would be much more pleasant with Hollywood like stunts and maybe with a strong story. Though the action stunts satisfied me, the story did not. Still I really heartily liked the way the movie ended and I felt it as a perfect conclusion of the series that began its journey in 2003. With Rohit Mehra's sacrifice, who was surprisingly rescued in the previous film and KRRISH being a father, of a child who would may be far more superior than even KRRISH had ever been, I feel that the series has reached its acme. This is why I have respectfully considered KRRISH series, which has been given its name by the second success named KRRISH, to be concluded by this 3rd part entitled KRRISH 3.

If you have watched any of the X-Men movies then do yourself a favour and miss this movie by a mile. I mean there are many ways to copy movies but this was a really pathetic attempt. A virus that looks like a bacteria. Telekinesis that needs fingers to control! There are so many holes in the plot that you will stop counting, none I mean none of it makes any sense, as my friend said, leave your brains at home to watch this one. Frankly, I think the director could have tried to make at least things a little more logical, everything they will try to explain to you like it was possible had huge gaping holes. Copying is okay but removing all logic from it is not! I could go on on what else made no sense, but then that would be classified as spoiler..

I took my 6 year old to watch it but after watching some horryfying scenes, he was asking if he can go home, so its not even a kids movie.

Please please, we all know Krish 4 will be coming soon, make it with some sense of logic and not for people with IQ of less than 70!

Ripped from various movies like, X-Men, Iron Man, Batman Series and many others, yeah all convoluted to this madness..

review_title: The best sci-fi movie ever came out of Hindi cinema
review_detailed_main: i am not going to write any spoilers here. The movies was fantabulous,amazing....didn't had enough expectations after watching the cartoon trailer,But here the proverb reminds me "never judge a book by its cover".Rakesh roshan is a master story teller and the story entirely makes sense!Its not like Ra.one but after watching this movie you wil not regret it for sure. its an full-on entertaining movie with mind-blowing action,vfx,story,acting and screenplay!! please go and watch it with your family and kids will love it. Kudos to Rakesh roshan for bringing such a mind blowing movie to Indian cinema..and double kudos to Hrithik,Kangana and Vivek for spectacular performances. youngsters may not like dis movie but watch it just for its entertainment quotient!! BLOCKBUSTER

review_title: Indian Action Flick with Hrithik ROSHAN
review_detailed_main:
Indian superhero film starring Hrithik Roshan and Priyanka Chopra

This film is the third part of the superhero series in which India's super star Hrithik Roshan (born 1974) not only stars as "Krrish" but also as his scientist dad. The story is told quickly: Krrish has to fight against the main villain Kaal (Vivek Oberoi), who wants to conquer the world with his mutants. His father, who is a scientist, supports him wherever possible. So nothing new on the superhero front! What makes things interesting is the villain Kaya (Kangana Renaut), who in the meantime manages to take on the form of Krrish's wife Priya (Priyanka Chopra, who stood between John Abraham and Abhishek Bachchan in "Dostana - Real Friends" (2008), which goes without saying causes some complications.

Made for $20 million, the film is quite impressive. It grossed $50 million worldwide. In addition to filming in Mumbai, there are also scenes shot in the Swiss Alps and the Jordanian desert.

For film fans who have little interest in the superhero genre, it can be refreshing to see how these types of (teen-oriented) films are approached in other film industries. Bollywood's B-movie charm certainly benefits the wild plot contortions of such films. What is striking is the exaggerated pathos. This is particularly noticeable in the scenes with the monument to Krrish and the overemphasis on Krrish's father's mental disability. But this also shows the special charm of this film. This lightens up an action that shouldn't be taken seriously anyway.

The dual role played by SuperStar Hrithik Roshan under the direction of his own father Rakesh Roshan is definitely worth watching. This actor not only succeeds in the entertaining action scenes in which he can flex his huge muscles, but also in the quiet moments in which he touchingly portrays the father's weakness. Hrithik Roshan has rightly become a global icon, as he has proven in his other films "Bang Bang!", "Mohenjo Daro" and "War" (with the great Tiger Shroff as his antagonist).

Krrish 3 is hands down the best CGI effects that Bollywood has produced so far but it fails to deliver the momentum that is needed to keep the audience engaged. Every so often you will encounter scenes that don't really contribute to the story line at all. There are songs when there really isn't need for any. All in all there's about 40 minutes of solid action at the end of this 152 minutes movie - not what you really expect when you sign up for super hero movies.

Directors need to dial down on the sentimental elements and focus more on the super hero elements. Also the characters in the movie will quite easily remind you of many Hollywood movies such as X-Men, Robocop, the Matrix and Resident Evil. In fact you can easily tell where they have ripped off CGI from other movies.

Bottom line - Krrish 3 makes a good effort to bring CGI to Bollywood but the blatant copy of scenes and effects straight from Hollywood movies plus the excruciatingly slow story line leaves you wondering how much value you are getting for your money.

review_title: Krrish- like a roller coaster ride that never gets going
A less entertaining superhero film, which can strictly be seen just for the old Hrithik and not the young Krrish.
review_detailed_main:
A film titled KRRISH 3 without having any KRRISH 2 in existence did create many big doubts among the viewers before its release quite rightly. Yet since it was more or less considered as a project mainly made for the kids, the expectations were not that huge and everyone just expected a decent entertainer and nothing else. But unfortunately it was really shocking to see that a director who is known to have a grasp of the medium, can make such a lackluster film without having anything special or enjoyable even for the kids in the age group of 10-15. And in case, one considers a few Shaktiman kind of sequences enough to satisfy the new generation kids well versed with DVDs, PSPs and X-boxes lying in their house at their easy disposals, then I seriously doubt about the level of awareness of that person and would like to disagree strongly.

As a result, instead of going into the pre and post interval details of KRRISH 3, I would like to mention that why it is in fact a huge disappointment from the once visionary director Rakesh Roshan, who gave us many enjoyable films in the past in the same genre.

1. After his last two hit ventures namely KOI MIL GAYA (2003) and KRRISH (2006), Rakesh Roshan was known to come up with films having some exclusive & entertaining content for kids. But surprisingly KRRISH 3 has no such specific sequences for the young ones to enjoy and they keep waiting for the same till the end.

2. Since his first film KHUDGARZ (1987), a Roshan venture has always been equipped with many melodious tracks, but here again there is not even a single song, able to impress the viewers in musical terms & the tracks prove to be big downers in the film as they come.

3. In his entire career as a director, Rakesh Roshan has played real well with the human emotions on screen, roped in beautifully in his screenplays. But we do not find any such triumph card played in KRRISH 3 and the film falls flat on the emotional level too unexpectedly.

4. Along with emotions, another major element which is completely missing in KRRISH 3 is COMEDY, which in fact has always been a subtle feature of such films based on heroes with some astonishing powers.

5. KRRISH 3 has only the experiments made by 'Kaal' as its USP which are also not exploited to the best (as was being publicized). The proceedings are all predictable (with no surprises) and there are no clap-worthy scenes in the entire film, like we had earlier seen in the first two parts of the series making an instant connect. Moreover the project has huge resemblances with many similar Hollywood films and the originality is simply missing in this third offering of the series, disappointingly.

6. Coming to the film's graphical representation, its indeed an appreciable decision to take that we will do all its graphical sequences in India itself through our own technical experts and not the foreigners. And the step duly deserves a big applause both from the industry as well as the viewers unanimously. But at the same time, the hard truth remains that we are still a long way behind the west in this particular field and a person can only enjoy the CGI works of KRRISH 3 if he hasn't seen any of the superhero films made in the west till date.

7. Yes, the project has a grand look, imaginative characters, fine makeovers, impressive action, great cinematography, an OK background score (which could be much better or energetic) and some fine acts too in totality. Yet what it misses the most is 'new content' to entertain and enthrall the audience. And that is the reason you tend to feel quite bored at times in this 150 minutes long film, made on all repetitive stuff.

8. Lastly coming to the basic character of Krishna in the film (who is the real person behind the masked KRRISH), one strongly finds no personal character of his own ever in the entire film, strangely. In fact he becomes the weakest part of the story, who doesn't have any likable persona of his own and is just interested in becoming Krrish whenever the need is there all of a sudden. In indicative words, we don't have any well defined Mr. PARKER here who turns into a SPIDERMAN at the time of crisis, which ideally has to be a key interesting feature of every superhero film.

Ending the analysis with the performances, KRRISH has a good act from Hrithik Roshan confidently playing the lead role, also displaying his adorable physique in the initial reels without the shirt. But his sincere effort is not supported well by the writers resulting in a visibly poor show overall. Still I loved watching his KOI MIL GAYA character in the old age (as the Papa Hrithik) a lot more that the young Krrish, quite honestly. Vivek Oberoi does well as the evil opposition, believing in weird body experiments based on fusions and Kangna impresses a lot, delivering a superb act in her new avatar. Priyanka Chopra is there playing her given role of Krishna's wife but actually she has nothing much to do in the film as per the script. Plus Nasseruddin Shah, Mohnish Bahl, Arif Zakaria and Rajpal Yadav are there only for a scene or two like the guest artists.

In all, KRRISH 3 is certainly not a thorough entertainer at all as projected. It begins well but then has nothing significant to offer in terms of thrill, emotions or enjoyable moments right till the climax, unexpectedly. Also, I couldn't find the good old entertaining, visionary director Rakesh Roshan, anywhere in the film to say the least.

review_title: Why 5 on 10? Well, I'm being generous today.
Loved it. The best visual effects so far in bollywood (and no where it looked cheap)
review_detailed_main:
Krissh 3 - wasn't expecting such a captivating movie in bollywood - but still went. Loved it. The best visual effects so far in bollywood (and no where it looked cheap). Simple plot and was kind of predictive (after having watched so many of Hollywood super hero movies and read enough comics) - but nonetheless - totally worth the money and time. Liked the balanced mix of time pass masala bollywood movie + super hero stuff.

And to those who talk about 'ripped off from this and that Hollywood super hero movies' - well you haven't read enough super hero comics to know that super heroes had been getting ripped off from one publisher to another over time and time again. (Although I am mainly talking about Marvel and DC comics mainly here - no offense to either - I love both the publisher's works).I find it pointless to criticize such a creative art on that basis - it's definitely not easy to blatantly create such a high quality effects by simply copying stuff.

Enjoyable and fun enough to warrant a watch. Even as a stand alone film (since it recaps the story very well at the beginning).

It quickly gained my favor due to the charming leads, and the sincerity and heart of the characters they are portraying.

Hrithik Roshan has a great physic, acts rather well and can handle himself on the dancefloor. And I was attracted to this movie by the look of the Hero Krrish, which is simple but striking. The ladies of the film, both the beautiful Priyanka Chopra and Kangana Ranaut (whom I saw here for the first time, and was easily my favorite) do a wonderful job as well. The villain is a bit weak (in mindset and look), but is a good bad guy nonetheless.

And although the story itself is nothing that hasn't been seen before, it works very well!

The whole thing is elevated by some great camera work, exaggerated action, interesting premises to put a hero into, good lines of dialogue, and more importantly.. plenty of showing not telling.

Very reminiscent of a few Superman comics, as well as the X-Men movie from the year 2000 (take that as you will).

There are a couple of Bollywood songs (as was expected), and even an Intermission (the movie is almost 2 and a half hours long). Would watch again. It's "dumb" at times, but there are days when I'm just in the mood for a product that was seemingly made with lots of energy and love.

review_title: Not For Avid Movie Watchers at ALL
MY REVIEW: Krrish is Here to Stay!!
review_detailed_main: Krrish 3 is average product by Hollywood standards but innovative by Bollywood standards. Krrish 3 works because it has Hollywood body around Bollywood soul. It works because Rakesh Roshan runs the show with good control during most of the running time. It works because Hrithik Roshan is such a delight to watch when he is playing three different characters; Rohit Mehra of Koi Mil Gaya, Krishna Mehra born in Krrish and Krrish of course. As Krishna he is good, as Rohit he is excellent and as Krrish he is charismatic and irresistible. Krrish 3 goes two steps ahead of Krrish and gives Bollywood audience the drama of superheroes, super villains, mutants, scientists that they have not tasted this way before. Special effects vary from tacky to absolutely stunning. Vivek Oberoi as Kaal and Kangana Ranaut as Kaya give pretty balanced performances. Priyanaka Chopra is average and does not have much to do here. Plot is predictable but quite enjoyable. Movie falters by being over melodramatic sometimes, having two extra songs and dragging the climax by around 10 minutes. It is a bumpy ride but a thrilling one. Make no mistake, Krrish 3 deserves a watch.

review_title: Ups the VFX Standard of Bollywood
Fans/Kids will love it.....others will suck it
review_detailed_main:
watched KRRISH 3 ...one thing was clear from the start no matter how good/bad this film is..we all gona watch it anyway..its been a decade since the first movie came out of this series in 2003 n than in 06..so we've been connected to this "desi superhero" for along time now....NOW the movie is good as per our "Indian terms" cause it has nice Action, cheap Sci-Fi, bit of Melodrama & it has a good plot(unlike most of the Bolly films nowadays)with the average screenplay....

The flick is also a clear rip off of many Holly n Bolly films(yes, even Bolly films)...mostly they copied action scenes...X-MEN,SUPERMAN,SPIDER MAN,BATMAN,TERMINATOR,TRANSFORMERS,STAR WARS,RA.ONE,ROBOT & even SHAKTIMAAN couldn't save himself form this piracy(if you've seen these you can also find the resemblance)...also its graphics are sh!t(come on its 2013)Bluntly if you can't match the level of the Holly's graphic quality you shouldn't make a movie like this(at the end of the day makers are gona earn for it).... Few amateur scenes, impelled dialogues & mediocre acting of the extras is really annoying throughout the film(at one point you wana punch those SOBs)

still I think its _WORTH A WATCH_

review_title: Little over hyped but overall a good movie
review_detailed_main:
The movie starts well, but overall I found it a little over hyped. Lot of concepts borrowed from Hollywood blockbusters like X-Men, Spiderman and Transformers. Plus the special effects seem to losing their touch if watched carefully. Seems like scenes which are normally scene in action games. Which clearly proves Bollywood is way behind Hollywood when it comes to special effects. Found the prequel (Krrish) more interesting than this one. Songs are good. Some scenes are heart touching. Hrithik rocks nevertheless. His six-pack and nicely chiseled body! just mind blowing. Hrithik is all over the movie. His style quotient is unmatched. He can easily give any Hollywood hero a run for his money with just his looks alone.

In the end I would just like to add that I don't think the makers could have done any better. They have given their best. So full marks to them as well. Its just that Bollywood would take its time to reach that level of brilliance which Hollywood has been showing for the past many years. One time watch. Good for kids. They will love it. Kids are definitely going to be repeat audience, but surely not adults.

review_title: Don't waste your time and money
review_detailed_main:
I went to theater to watch this movie as my wife wanted to see it. I know husbands are helpless when it comes to wives. I hardly had any exceptions from this movie at all. You can almost guess how good a Bollywood movie would be based on its cast and director. Still, I was a bit curious as I had hardly seen any super-hero movie from Bollywood.

Krrish 3 was pure waste of time. I am not sure why do they make such pathetic movie, ridden with terrible emotional drama and copied actions. The story was purely baseless and unconvincing. As several other reviews pointed out, the action scenes were copied from other Hollywood flicks. Despite all plagiarism, they could not come with a decent movie. Songs were truly forgettable and for acting I would not be thrilled. My suggestion would be totally give a pass to this movie and do not waster your money and time.

review_title: Renaissance of Bollywood's sci-fi action movie.. The BEST!!
review_detailed_main:
When I watched the movie's trailer for the first time, what I found (and that too in BULK) was the group of people talking about its VFX and its plagiarism from Hollywood movies like Superman, X-man, etc. I was surprised to read all those stupid comments because honestly speaking as an Indian, I felt proud to see such a wonderful work by Indian experts. YOU SHOULD ALL BE PROUD OF THE FACT THAT KRRISH-3 IS 100% MADE IN India and therefore in order to see the strength of BOLLYWOOD, I went to see Krrish 3 today. Trust me when I say this guys, it is one of the best movie I have seen in my life with amazing special effects, amazing performance by all actors (especially Hrithik Roshan) and 100% dedication by Mr. Rakesh Roshan. This movie is a special Deepavali gift from the Roshan's and honestly speaking, no other gift could be as better as this.

Conclusion: Krrish-3 is a treat to watch for everyone.. I would strongly recommend everyone to go and enjoy it and those who are complaining about the VFX or duplication from Hollywood movies, you better watch Dabangg or Rowdy Rathore (lol :P)

review_title: Krrish 3 disappoints in terms of direction and story but is saved by brilliant CGI and enduring performance by Hrithik
review_detailed_main:
As you will see the first trailer of Krish 3 , certain scenes of Hollywood movies will come to your mind creating a deja vu. Believe me , you are absolutely right, Krrish 3 is result of all of best scenes plucked out from some of best Hollywood action flicks and bind together into a single movie.

Krrish is leading a happy family life along with his scientist father , Rohit Mehra and journalist wife , Priya. Along comes a new threat in form of evil, Kaal who threatens to end the world and build his own empire.

It is sad to see that we have so much talent in Bollywood and yet we directly copy scenes from Hollywood and give our own name. Rakesh Roshan picks the best of lot from each film, adds in typical melodrama which creates boredom and polishes with es tactic CGI. His direction is utterly poor by introducing new love story ( between Hrithik and Kangana )to already fuzzed out chemistry of Hrithik and Priyanka. Screenplay is poor. Editing needs serious attention. Music by Rajesh Roshan is disappointing. Art direction is good along with eye-catching cinematography. Hats off to the special effects team for bringing technical brilliance to poorly written film. Watch for the climax scene showing the building collapse which is bravely shot. Hrithik Roshan stands out as Indian Super hero with his well-chiseled physique. Not only he suits the character of Krrish , he emote expressively both as father and son. Vivek Oberoi does a good job as evil Kaal. Kangana Raunat surprises you with her charm and acting. Priyanka Chopra is wasted.

Overall , Krrish 3 disappoints in terms of direction and story but is saved by brilliant CGI and enduring performance by Hrithik. Decent 2.75/5

review_title: Visually stunning, Brilliant performances but a poor story
review_detailed_main: Was disappointed because of a weak plot. Also, too many product/brand placements spoiled the fun of watching the movie. Although the performances were outstanding. Everyone in the cast has made an outstanding effort. Some special mentions are- Hrithik Roshan for the amazing way he has played all three roles- Rohit, Krishna and Krrish, Vivek Oberoi for effortlessly portraying Kaal and Kangana Ranaut for her sexy mutant avatar as Kaaya. The music was not upto the Rajesh Roshan standard, which used to mesmerize us in his earlier ventures like Yaarana, Baaton baaton Mein , Kaho Naa Pyaar Hai to name a few. It is strictly average. I attribute the 200+ crore BO collections simply to Hrithik Roshan's acting, Rakesh Roshan's vision of a sci-fi superhero film and To Vivek Oberoi's and Kangana's performances and to never-before-seen VFX, made in India, for India. It is a one-time watch.

review_title: Bad SNL skit meets unreleased Power Rangers episode
review_detailed_main:
I don't even know where to start.

We sometimes watch terrible movies for laughs. "So bad it's good" is a thing, right? Unfortunately, Krrish 3 doesn't fit that description. This -I hesitate to call it a "movie"-is 160 minutes of incomprehensible nonsense, coupled with:

-acting that makes The Room look like Casablanca -special effects that look like a failed PS2 bargain basement game trailer -costume design that is SO bad, it has to be intentional -a plot line so utterly content-free that they have to fill up 50% of the film with superfluous song-and-dance numbers -cinematography so flat, it looks like a home video of tweens acting out a Power Rangers fight scene 20 years ago.

I really can't make much more of it. This is the worst thing I've ever seen. Don't watch it. Ever.

review_title: Krrish 3: Blockbuster Written all over it!!!
review_detailed_main: With a visually riveting and emotionally engaging story, intriguing characters, sweeping VFX (unseen thus far on Indian celluloid) Rakesh Roshan's ambitious dream lives up. Yes, it's hugely inspired (by the Bats, Spideys and Wolverines of the West), but our superhero has his own 'X- factor'. Even with all the high-octane car crashes, explosions and 'animatronics', the philosophy is the force behind it all, yet, never overpowering the story. For sheer vision, bravado and superlative execution, this one soars to new orbits. Latch on to this cape for an exhilarating ride. Note: You might not like this film if sci-fi, fantastical films are not your scene!!! Surpasses Koi Mil Gaya(2003) and Krrish(2006) its predecessors!!! Will sure to make a Bollywood history in terms of box-office collections!!!!

Movie is fantabulous by all means. India is a developing country not a developed one like many western countries. So, if you are expecting a scifi thriller like Hollywood, then of course it will take time to reach that level. But considering all the things, I would rate Krrish3 as extremely good movie. Superb plot, superb execution. Rakesh roshan never tried to get away with by chalta hai attitude. Movie is made with big hardwork which can be easily seen. Marks are given for hardwork and considering all the means including money available to make such thrillers, I am extremely happy that India is slowly getting at par with Hollywood.

Must must watch. Fully entertaining.

The movie has no story. Fight scenes in the movie were also not so good. Krrish 1 was so good but Krrish 3 was worst.

review_title: KRRISH - saves many in the movie but not the movie audience
review_detailed_main:
Heard about X-Men ? Heard about Spiderman? Heard about Superman or batman?

If you've even heard about any of the above or seen 'em and if you are an adult then this movie is to be avoided. Villains from Amazing Spiderman movie and the characters from X Men are copied. Final scene reminded me of a bad imitation of the Man of Steel fights. Some possible merits in the movie include Hrithik's Charisma (indeed he is too-too handsome), Special effects/graphics (Good with Bollywood standards not Hollywood)and to mention beauty of Priyanka and Kangna. The actors did a fine job to the script which was too weak. Music and comedy was just okay. The bottom line is that this movie just might be enjoyable to children (may be) but not to others.

Krrish 3 definitely takes bollywood to the next level, with some great special effects which is close to perfection.

However, the story-line, characterization, and unnecessary songs and dialogs spoil such an incredible effort.

Vivek oberoi - Mix of Magneto and Professor X from X-men Kangna Ranaut - Mystique from X men Krrish - Weaker version of Superman - Getting energy from the Sun A self made characterization would have definitely made justice to the special effects Some of the dialogs are too dramatic, and unnecessary. It's like spoon-feeding us on what's happening. Come on guys, give the audience room to think on their own. Treat us like adults. The lesser you reveal, the more interesting and real it becomes.

Songs act as a spoiler for a superhero movie, unless it is a part of the plot and is important. The songs in this movie, spoils the momentum of the movie and diverts our attention towards something silly. This is a lesson Bollywood needs to learn. You may match Hollywood in VFX effects. However, what matters is the way you present. The plot,the direction, and the story telling is whats more important. VFX effects come as a bonus. Get the basics right before we try something bigger.

This movie could have been made so much better! Good effort though!

Rating:- 4.5/5

From dabbling with reincarnation-oriented sagas to being a pioneer in introducing aliens and superheroes in Bollywood arena, director Rakesh Roshan has come a long way. His latest offering, Krrish 3 begins almost after five years where Krrish ended. Krishna, played by Hritik Roshan, is now a happily married man who takes up odd jobs ( security guard , waiter !!) to keep his alter-ego concealed while Papa Rohit is busy with his research pursuits, accompanied with Bournvita! Things are hunky dory until Krrish's nemesis – Kaal(played by Vivek Oberoi) unleashes a trail of terror with his evil mutants and the cat suit-clad Kaya(Kangana Ranaut), a chameleonisque human who shifts loyalties and falls in love with Krishna. With all its melodrama, twists involving an inventive face-off formula and blatant merchandising, it boils down to the philosophical triumph of good over evil.

For superhero movie buffs, Krrish3 would resemble a concoction of several Hollywood biggies (Superman, Spiderman) and Roshan seems to recreate the action sequences amidst sprawling and dazzling skyscrapers ( in Mumbai !!) copying the Hollywood counterparts, without quite building a pressure-cooker urgency. The screenplay is footloose and the EQ which resonated with every Filmkraft venture is brazenly misplaced. The second half does raise some hopes with a catchy soundtrack( Dil Tu hi Bata, simmering with the beauty of the exotic locales) but Roshan's team of writers eventually fall into the trap of juvenile story-telling replete with clumpy dialogues, downgrading the intrigue factor.

All said and done, Krrish 3 is only worth watching because of Hritik's regaling performance. With a beefed-up musculature, he delivers a committed and the most sincere act displaying an array of palpable emotions. As the paunchy Rohit, he brings in the composure and child- like mannerisms which makes us nostalgic as memories of Koi Mil Gaya flash before our eyes. While all the entities around him are irresistibly ridiculous including the most sketchily written character of Priyanka Chopra,it is Kangana who ably compliments him with striking vulnerability and sensuality. There is a devilish aura around Vivek Oberoi and he cashes on it to play the wheelchair-stuck villain with impeccable perfection. Really , if Kaal says "Fusion is the future", then we gotta agree that this baddie will shine in the future!

I go with Two and Half out of Five for Krrish 3.All the jazz, the startling visual imagery can barely compensate for the soul which the film lacks. We see a tremendous scope for a sequel with another child prodigy born, but the Roshans must reinvent themselves and come out of the archaic treatment they meted out to this ambitious film.

Clearly, those challenges are quite visible in director Rakesh Roshan's third installment – 'Krrish3'. He has, however, obediently stuck to the fundamentals of spinning a superhero movie that centres on the battle of the good versus the bad, but it's his decision to limit the visual effects that makes his effort rather unimaginative.

The script has all the elements an exciting superhero film must have. A vulnerable masked crusader, a malevolent super villain, who's as far away from redemption as heaven is from hell. A revenge story. And the ultimate battle – the triumph of good over evil (wait for the climax!). The best part? It isn't an all-indulgent film that focuses only on the greatness of Krrish. Sure, there are scenes that display his absolute power and goodness but hey, what the hell, aren't these what we all really crave to see in this kind of a film? While the first half is mainly to establish the characters, it's the second half that holds your attention till the last frame. Considering 75% of the film has VFX, the graphics seem a bit sketchy in a few initial scenes. But where it matters the most, like the climax, its bang on! Among the songs, Dil Ti hi Bat is definitely the pick of the lot. Coming to the star cast, this is Hrithik Roshan's film all the way. He dons the roles of Rohit, Krrish and Krishna with ease. His performance evokes all the right emotions. You love him as Rohit, you desire him as the doting husband Krishna and you want to see him triumphant as Krrish. HR is India's only superhero. Period.

But it must be said that Vivek Oberoi lends ample and more support to HR. If HR is a superhero, VO is the perfect super villain. It is a towering performance. From his menacing entry right up to the end. The leading ladies have equally fleshed out parts. While Priyanka Chopra is good as the love of Krrish's life, it's Kangana Ranaut who stands out. Besides looking her part, stunning and sexy, she's also managed to work on her diction and speech problems. You will see a new and improved Kangana in this film.

Hats off to Rakesh Roshan for dreaming big and actually pulling off this risky proposition. Krrish 3 is spectacular, blockbuster entertainment. The scenes that are heavily inspired from hit Hollywood superhero franchises notwithstanding.

review_title: A Landmark Film in World Cinema ... breaks down boundaries and raises the bar for superhero films everywhere, with emotional 'connect' Hollywood can only envy
review_detailed_main:
Forget anything you may have heard or comparisons you might have imagined about "Krrish 3" – it's just a GREAT MOVIE. Period.

By any standard.

For sheer emotional wallop, "Krrish 3" has no peer among 'superhero' movies anywhere.

Complex and multi-layered story, standout performances, exciting action, memorable characters, and breakthrough visual effects make "Krrish 3" a landmark film in world cinema. But it's the power of its emotional connect with the audience – fuelled as it is by real human relationship, that each of us can identify with personally in our own way – that sets "Krrish 3" above even mega-blockbuster Hollywood movies with 12 times the budget but no soul.

What sets "Krrish 3" apart?

Story. Plot. Character. The three essential elements of any good storytelling. "Krrish 3" not only uses Story, Plot, and Character to tell an inspiring and exciting superhero story, but does so from a uniquely Indian perspective all the more powerful because the relationships portrayed are actually universal to all human life.

Above all, "Krrish 3" is an unparallelled celebration of ... Humanity. In all our strength. In all our weakness.

Master director-producer Rakesh Roshan once again proves his vision to 'push the boundaries' for what Hindi cinema can and does achieve.

Synopsis for anyone catching up: Ten years ago "Koi ... Mil Gaya" (2003) introduced India's first successful science fiction movie by giving us Rohit Mehra, a braindamaged child-adult who befriends a space alien (whom he calls 'Jaadu', meaning 'magic') accidentally stranded on Earth that thanks Rohit for his help by healing, even enhancing, his damaged brain. Seven years ago "Krrish" (2006) gave us Krishna Mehra, Rohit's son, who was born with supra-normal abilities because of his father's 'enhancement' by Jaadu, and eventually takes on the superhero identity Krrish. With the help of a journalist (Priya, whom Krishna loves) Krishna rescues his father, the now-genius Rohit, from long-term imprisonment by an evil scientist. Thus at the outset of "Krrish 3" (2013), Krishna and Priya are newlyweds. Rohit explores how to be a father to a grown son. And 'Krrish' is the public's hero who is an inspiration to all. But trouble lurks just around the corner: a twisted genius known as 'Kaal' has unleashed an army of half-human, half-animal mutants to exploit and then bring down human civilisation.

What Happens Next ... you simply must experience!

Hrithik Roshan ... playing the triple-role which spans the physicality (impressive!) of superhero Krrish combined with the confused 'everydayness' of alter ego Krishna (who can't keep a regular job!) and yet again the residually 'childlike' genius scientist, the aging Rohit. COULD any other actor have carried this off? Period? In a word, NO.

As Subhash K Jha famously said of Hrithik's début, "Kaho Naa ... Pyaar Hai" (2000): "Would Paris be the same without the Eiffel Tower?"

Similarly, the entire Krrish franchise – whether Rohit in "Koi ... Mil Gaya", Krishna in "Krrish", or full-on superhero Krrish in "Krrish 3" – would not, could not, exist without the unique talents and dramatic range of one actor. Hrithik Roshan.

The other primary cast are also great in "Krrish 3". Vivek Oberoi, for instance, makes the most of this opportunity to be very good (which is to say, very bad, as the ultra-evil supervillain 'Kaal') in this very good movie.

Yet top raves for the women in "Krrish 3".

All too often a female actor is given little chance to do more than 'look pretty and dance a little'. This is why it is SO refreshing that both Priyanka Chopra ('Priya') and Kangana Ranaut (the mutant 'Kaya') play such memorably three-dimensional characters in "Krrish 3".

Ms Ranaut is spectacular in this movie! She's gorgeous. She's deadly. She's (literally) a cold-blooded killer, being half-chameleon. Yet her character's discovery of her own latent human side will touch your heart.

Not to be outdone, Ms Chopra's role, too, has unexpected shades to her performance. And watch carefully for one scene where even Mr Roshan is ... not quite what he seems! Exactly the sort of plot twists that keep an audience on the edge of their seat to the final frame.

The technical departments are all top-notch. Hong Kong's legendary action director Tony Ching Siu-Tung returns from "Krrish" to elicit even more breathtaking fight sequences in "Krrish 3", and pushed all actors to their physical limits and beyond. The art design by Sabu Cyril shows you a birds-eye perspective of Mumbai (especially dramatic at night) which only a bird – or a superhero – would normally see. The sound design by Baylon Fonseca was also extraordinary.

Rajesh Roshan's music for "Krrish 3" is not standard Bollywood movie fare, because this music is very specific to this film and no other. Where else, for instance, are you likely to have occasion for a mutant's fantasy about discovering love? Which is why, when you actually see this film, all three of the song sequences work beautifully to underscore the emotional content of the plot.

Special credit to the"Krrish 3" team for bravely keeping all the computer visual effects work (VFX) 100% 'made in India' for the first time ... and on such a showcase project, so brilliantly realised throughout. And at reportedly ONE TWELFTH the cost of similar Hollywood VFX-intensive superhero films, with such results, "Krrish 3" alone could open Indian VFX companies to the international film market.

In sum: a landmark milestone in Hindi cinema. As Hrithik Roshan said recently in a UK interview, "The basic content of a Hindi movie is really being challenged here." The standard-of-excellence has been raised to global level with "Krrish 3", while remaining true to Indian culture and values.

Director Rakesh Roshan deserves HUGE credit for: (1) the Vision; (2) the Courage to pursue that vision; and (3) the Skill to transform that vision into groundbreaking cinema.

This film may not be compare with the Hollywood super hero movies in terms of the budget but it has more emotion & drama than the Hollywood movies.The VFX are world class in the small budget.You cant expect more than that from such a small budget film compare to Hollywood.Friends don't believe in others its a 10/10 movie in terms of everything.I have seen some of the reviews saying that the concept of the movie is borrowing and the VFX's are not up to standard,i wants to say them one thing before comparing any movie with other Plz don't forget about the budget.Krrish 3 is about 1percentage of the Internationale standard Hollywood movies. So keep it in mind and if you are typical Indian love story fan then its not u r cup of tea.

In short Krrish 3 is Amazing. But yes if you will unfairly compare it with Hollywood stuff, then you might be disappointed. But that will be unfair, as I said, due to obvious budget constraints. But if compared to previous Krrish, or RA 1 or Robot, K3 is superb. The VFX are amazing, never seen before in a Bollywood movie. Hrithik is just outstanding as Krrish and Rohit Mehra. Vivek and Kagana are impressive too. Songs are a bit let down, maybe because of poor lyrics. Raghupati Raghav is good though, maybe it looks good because of Hrithik's dance moves. Rakesh Roshan's direction, as usual, is brilliant. He is one of the better directors in India, the one who has guts to make something different from the usual Masala Flicks. Enjoy Krrish 3, our Indian super hero, but don't compare it with Hollywood movies. We can't afford their budget. These kind of movies need support from Indian audience else directors will keep making movies like Chennai Express etc. Thumbs up to KRRISH 3 from my side, and my entire family loved it.

review_title: India has arrived on the world stage!!
review_detailed_main: It may not be in the league of the likes of superman &/or batman in terms of technical quality but still it does bring to us the first true Indian superhero & man he does fit the bill nicely. And mind you all, in a miserly budget of around 1200 millions as compared to 6000 millions for the recently critically acclaimed gravity.. So we must not compare the two ..the director must be thrown accolades for thinking & doing different... The direction & script does have its ups &downs but its the performances & first of its kind of cinematic excellence seen in India & being carried forth.. Hrithik shines in action sequences & enacts the old man role with aplomb & hats off to the mean cruel sinister look portrayed by vivek who throws his punches & lines with equal ease and authority,in fact he is a delight to watch.. Also worth mentioning is the work of Kangana, a smart chiseled look & a breather from the so typical act of her co-actress.,, visual effects are quite decent but for the budget... Unnecessary songs do add to the length & could have been avoided,,,Hrithik in his cool new body fits perfectly as a Superman... For the vision, the first of its kind visual effects by an Indian & a superb villain, this flick is a watch...It seems to have its heart in the right place & people around the world can expect more and better stuff to roll out from India soon...

Bollywood may not have evolved in technology as much as Hollywood has, but its not far behind. Even if the technology isn't developed Bollywood still can put up a great fight. This has been clearly proved by Rakesh Roshan and the entire team of Krrish 3. Krrish 3 is a benchmark in Indian Cinem. Both in terms of technology and film making. There have been dozens of sequels in Bollywood but none of them were actually sequels. Making a sequel needs great detailing because you need to connect the dots to make a bridge between the prequel and the sequel. Krrish was a true sequel and Krrish 3 is no less. It has the connection.

Krrish 3 has all the important ingredients. Action, Message, Emotions, Technique. It doesn't miss a mark anywhere. It is logical and doesn't challenge your intelligence. The only loop hole in the movie is the twist with Kaya. Its way too predictable.

Now talking about the performances, Priyanka Chopra does good with whatever she is given. Viveik Oberoi, who had become the King of Cringe Cinema, breaks the shackles here. He delivers a performance worth appreciating. His Kaal truly leaves a deep impression in comparison to Krrish. But the film belongs to Hrithik Roshan! Be it as the genius man child Rohit or the superhero Krrish. He takes the film to an entirely different level. The smile, the intensity. He wins you over with every thing a million of times. The final fight between Krrish and Kaal in every aspect. Hrithik Roshan is the main reason.

I am going with three and half out five for "Krrish 3". Hollywood superhero films are adapted comic characters, but the character Krrish is original. There are many chances you will find yourself whistling, clapping and cheering, such is the power possessed by the film and the message it delivers. Go for IT!

review_title: Krrish 3 is a better movie than what people are reading in reviews
review_detailed_main:
I watched this movie today, and was considering should I watch this movie or not after reading a string of bad reviews. Thankfully I watched the movie.

I will mention the Pros and Cons of the movies:

Pros: 1. Hrithik Roshan: He is the USP of the movie no doubt. From his perfectly toned body. To his perfect face expressions. Don't forget he is playing both an elderly man and the Superhero.

2. Special Effects: I heard the special effects are very childish and all. I don't say they are flawless, but they are not bad either.

3. Kangna Ranauts Acting: Can't believe I am writing this but Kangna has done justice to her role. For the first time I felt she has actually acted well.

Cons:

1. Music: There are 3 songs in this movie. I didn't feel the songs are good. They could have been much better, I think Rakesh Roshan should not hire Rajesh Roshan any more.

2. Copying of characters from Hollywood: If you have seen X-Men series you will definitely be able to see a resemblance to some of the characters.

All said, I would say it is way better than RA.One and The amazing SpiderMan. No idea why people are saying its not good.
