and 1 last thing...the songs were crappy...background score was OK but the songs really lacked melody..especially "Dil Tu Hi Bata"..i can make a better song than that in bathroom... Anyway it was a great entertainer...Once again awesome fight scenes... nice job...Go for it...u won't b disappointed

Creating a world of superheroes on screen isn't a cakewalk. And, the exercise turns immensely trickier when there's no comic history to fall back on.

Clearly, those challenges are quite visible in director Rakesh Roshan's third installment – 'Krrish3'. He has, however, obediently stuck to the fundamentals of spinning a superhero movie that centres on the battle of the good versus the bad, but it's his decision to limit the visual effects that makes his effort rather unimaginative.

The script has all the elements an exciting superhero film must have. A vulnerable masked crusader, a malevolent super villain, who's as far away from redemption as heaven is from hell. A revenge story. And the ultimate battle – the triumph of good over evil (wait for the climax!). The best part? It isn't an all-indulgent film that focuses only on the greatness of Krrish. Sure, there are scenes that display his absolute power and goodness but hey, what the hell, aren't these what we all really crave to see in this kind of a film? While the first half is mainly to establish the characters, it's the second half that holds your attention till the last frame. Considering 75% of the film has VFX, the graphics seem a bit sketchy in a few initial scenes. But where it matters the most, like the climax, its bang on!

Among the songs, Dil tu hi bata is definitely the pick of the lot. Coming to the star cast, this is Hrithik Roshan's film all the way. He dons the roles of Rohit, Krrish and Krishna with ease. His performance evokes all the right emotions. You love him as Rohit, you desire him as the doting husband Krishna and you want to see him triumphant as Krrish. HR is India's only superhero. Period.

But it must be said that Vivek Oberoi lends ample and more support to HR. If HR is a superhero, VO is the perfect super villain. It is a towering performance. From his menacing entry right up to the end. The leading ladies have equally fleshed out parts. While Priyanka Chopra is good as the love of Krrish's life, it's Kangana Ranaut who stands out. Besides looking her part, stunning and sexy, she's also managed to work on her diction and speech problems. You will see a new and improved Kangana in this film.

Hats off to Rakesh Roshan for dreaming big and actually pulling off this risky proposition. Krrish 3 is spectacular, blockbuster entertainment. The scenes that are heavily inspired from hit Hollywood superhero franchises notwithstanding.

For sheer vision, bravado and superlative execution, this one soars to new orbits. Latch on to this cape for an exhilarating ride.

Note: You might not like this film if sci-fi, fantasy films are not your scene.

review_title: Very futuristic & bold move in Indian cinema
review_detailed_main: I enjoyed this movie when marvel & dc is dominating this movie is was good to watch writing is good kept you indulge in every aspect of this film waiting for part 4.

In my honest opinion, making a film of this genre is itself an uphill task. Father son duo, Rakesh and Hrithik impresses us thoroughly. This movie is a masterpiece when it comes to Sci Fi attempts which the Indian Cinema has underwent earlier. Vfx, Make up, character imagination is all top class. Now the whole point is if I start comparing this with Spiderman or Avengers, it wouldn't make a point considering the technical limitations and expertise and disposal at our end. Leaving these points this movie is extremely enjoyable for all ages. So the most awaited movie doesn't disappoint us at all.

Cons:- Songs were just not needed. Rest the movie is fully watchable and enjoyable with the whole family across generations

I watched this movie on last Saturday with my family and thanks Rakesh Roshan to bring this wonderful movie to us.Hats off to the effort of him that we can proudly say that India can deliver this king of larger then life movies. Just amazing.

Superheroes have been around in Hindi cinema for decades, but huge technology jumps have made 'Krrish 3' the slickest of them all, special effects-wise.Hrithik is the perfect choice amongst the Bollywood superstar lot to do this role. With his superbly articulated chest, each muscle moving and shiny and oiled, Krrish doesn't even need a mask and a cape. But the ensemble is eye-catching, and we ignore his immaculately-styled long hair, flying in the wind, when he is whizzing about rescuing little boys. Roshan Jr is as likable and earnest as he usually is, but can't rise above the mothballed treatment. Roshan Sr, who has written and directed, should have given the superhero more to do.

review_title: Excellent Movie ! A giant leap for Bollywood !
review_detailed_main: I was apprehensive if Bollywood could pull off such an ambitious super- hero movie with mutants and megalomaniacs. But after watching the movie, I was amazed by the progress we have made in special effects and I think Hollywood would soon be knocking on Roshan's door. Rakesh Roshan's direction is terrific, Hrithik Roshan is perfect for Krrish, and the only disappointment is Rajesh Roshan's music and songs. Hrithik pulls off the father-son double role splendidly and I can see a Filmfare Best Actor award for him again. Among the other actors, Vivek Oberoi impresses as Kaya and Kangana Ranaut has done a good job as Kaya. Even though the movie's length might seem long at 2 hours and 30 minutes, the pace of the movie and the storyline ensures that you are never bored. This is a landmark movie for Bollywood and it clearly shows we have arrived.

review_title: Finally We Get Our Own Superhero and Boy He's Awesome
review_detailed_main:
Reviewed by: Dare Devil Kid (DDK) Rating: 3.9/5 stars

Bollywood's first really good superhero film. Admittedly more than a few of its characters are inspired or amalgamated from their Hollywood counterparts, but they have been portrayed in a way that ultimately makes us warm up to their home-bred avatars. And truth be told, even though it mightn't be in the league of "The Avengers", "The Dark Knight Trilogy", most of the "X-Men" films, "Thor 1 and 2", or the first two "Iron Man" movies, it's still way better than overblown, mind-numbing CGI turds such as "Iron Man 3", "Captain America", or "Green Lantern".

The VFX are totally indigenous and a landmark for Indian cinema. Hrithik, Vivek, and Kangana pack a real wallop with their characters and Roshan Sr. has meticulously carved their story arcs. Priyanka, like in most of her movies, goes overboard with her sometimes helpless, sometimes confident act. Many of the action scenes stay with you long after you've exited the movie hall, and the climax, especially, is something to be marveled at.

If you can just tune off your senses during the the unnecessary and corny songs, (there are only about three of them) then you'll definitely be entertained to the highest levels by the plot, drama, and mind- blowing action of "Krrish 3". Ultimately, it's a movie that effectively conveys and permeates a overall aura of good triumphing over evil in the end, no matter what the odds. You'll end up leaving the theater with a loft, pepped-up, inspirational, and just a good feeling all round.

Watch our first, very own, superhero for what it show itself to be - try not to unduly and unfairly draw comparison with it and some superior Hollywood fare - and you'll end up warming up to what might be India's initiation into its first, bonafide superhero franchise.

review_title: Krrish definitely is the best Indian super hero so far :)
review_detailed_main:
Krrish 3 shows how much Indian cinema has advanced in terms of visual effects(could say its the best in India so far). Rakesh Roshan has put in an incomparable effort in making a spectacular super hero for India Lives upto the expectations. Any body who has watched super hero movies like spiderman, man of steel, thor, hulk and so on would have wished for such a super hero character for India. Well folks krrish is exactly the one for you then.

Our hero Krishna is married to his lady love Priya. They live with his father, Rohit Mehra who works for the well being of the society. His main goal is an experiment which, with the help of sun rays, will bring life into the dead.In another part of the world Kaal, an evil genius, is selfishly misusing his powers to spread fear, death and destruction with the help of the mutants that he has created. What Kaal seeks is the bone marrow that can help him stand on his own feet and our hero krrish and his father rohit are the only ones who can stop him before kaal gets what he wants.The 1st half of the movie entertains you to the core. Second half slows down a bit but catches its pace soon enough. both the roles are perfect for Hrithik Roshan and he has done a descent job. The main negatives of the movie are the songs, Which isn't really required for a science fiction movie(and the villain could have had a better costume - my opinion :P) and one could feel that the movie adapted some of the ideas from the Xmen movie series. On the whole its definitely a movie to be watched on the big screen ,its stupendous action sequences , above average plot, the little twists , small messages and the amazing super hero powers and abilities keeps one entertained throughout its run-time (beware of the below average songs though! One might find it irritating).Krrish 3 may not be a perfect movie but it is certainly a bollywood super hero movie which you wouldn't wanna miss this diwali.. Rating - 7.5/10

Well directed super hero movie till date from India. Used few concepts of resident evil(virus & underground tunnels in kaal hideout), matches few action scenes of Man of steel(on air actions of Kaal and Krrish),and few concepts of X-men but beautifully added them and produced a full new theme for the movie. Accept for three scenes (entry of krrish while running over the bridge in slow motion background was quit faster, action scene of saving 6 people at once at the end, and the costume of kaal with a kind of cricket helmet) everything else looks Quite naturally. All totally, this time Bollywood have successfully overcome there limits and was able to create a sci-fi movie with a nice concept of solar energy. If such progress continues in future this movie will be a serious threat for all other International super heroes (X-men group and avengers). All the best to Rakesh Roshan, hope you can overcome all those present drawbacks and Thanks for a great movie. This movie is worth watching.

review_title: Krrish:3 the best super-hero movie ever!
review_detailed_main:
Krrish:3 movie is absolutely great,it's one of the best movies ever made in Bollywood. I think every Bollywood fan must watch Krrish:3 and experience the magic!

Hrithik Roshan was incredible in both roles as Krrish & Rohit Mehra. He once again showed why he is the true perfectionist of Bollywood. Priyanka Chopra was really sweet in her act as Priya. Vivek Oberoi was unbelievable as violent super-villain Kaal. It's possibly the best performance ever by an actor in a negative role. That was a great effort by him to make such a transformation. Even Kangana Ranaut was good in her deadly role.

The visual effects of the movie are up to International standards! It's even better than Hollywood flicks. The songs are great as well, Raghupati Raghav is the best of them all. The clash between the super-hero and super-villain in the end was breathtaking. Krrish:3 is one of the best movies of the year so far and I hope the film,Hrithik Roshan and Vivek Oberoi will get all awards. They really deserve it. Mr.Rakesh Roshan is truly one of the greatest film-makers. Krrish is simply the best Indian super-hero ever! All 3 movies in Krrish trilogy - Koi Mil Gaya,Krrish and Krrish 3 are outstanding. Hats off to the entire team of Krrish 3!

krrish3 is not a type of Indian super hero films,it is not even meet with Hollywood movies its very unique and need guts.so we should appreciate rakesh roshans attempt towards perfection.krrish3 is a complete visual treat.story lacks the charm and innocence of prequels,but catches you by its solid action sequences.music is a disaster .but the thing worth your ticket is performances.hrithik is the best in whole cast and crew and delivers his triple role at the edge of perfection.next in acting depairment is vivek.he is highly menacing in wheel chair as a handicapped.kangana is cool and she is the heroine of the film.priyanka is a big dis appointment.over all performances are vry wise.totally kkrrish Is flawed but its an answer to Hollywood to some extent.its worth every penny.go fopr it.

review_title: Kundos to India's First Super Hero - Krrish
review_detailed_main:
First of all , I call those ppl "STUPID" those who try to compare this movie with Hollywood movie!! I mean what do you expect in a 50 crore budget ?? ANOTHER AVATAR??? you must be kidding.!!

Don't be just Hollywood Flatterer.

No doubt it is inspired by few Hollywood movies. but i will not say it's a complete copy.. ppl say it's a copy of X-men? I want to ask them which X-men movies showed that mutants are born in labs or test tubes?

This movie just take the theme of mutants and I will not say it's a copy. Of-course, you will not say Twilight is inspired by Underworld because both movies have Vampires and Werewolf. !!

I really appreciate the attempts of Roshans , at least they did something which is different from regular bollywood masala flicks. And I am sure it would inspire other directors too to think different.

Story line is good, Action scenes are superb with great visual effects. Only drawback of the movies it's songs and cheesy dialogues.. but it can be ignored. over n all a must watch movie.

This year, we have other Bollywood movies to do better like Dhoom 3 and so on. But for a Indian superhero movie, it have almost everything right,the story,the characters, the dialogs and the visuals. I am not tell it is like Ra one or others blockbuster Hollywood movies. The visuals looked like in video game style so it can be passed. As for the villain, he is mean and scary at times but he is no joker. He is good for a villain but not the extend.The best part of all this is the ending. Even though it was long, it is dramatic but with action. At the end, if you saw Krrish, you would like this movie better. It is a improvement from Krrish.

review_title: KRRISH 3 is a riveting,with brilliant performances & great visuals
review_detailed_main:
Krrish is back with a bang in the genre of superheroes.

Story- Its rare in bollywood, that a megabudget flick has a straightforward storyline. Movie is perfectly paced. Screenplay is apt. and really good. It Gets - 9/10

Direction & Other Technical Stuffs- Direction is really of the highest level. Roshan Sr. is the old gun of the movie who managed the things perfectly. He also provided the much needed indigenous flavor to the movie with a hint of melodrama.Editing is sharp,really sharp indeed.Other dept.s were good. (Except songs which I don't consider for this genre) It Gets - 9.5/10

Performances- Hrithik Roshan is getting better movie by movie. As Krrish/Krishna he looks perfect has done perfectly with all kinds scenes (especially action ones).AS Rohit he is better than the best. Rohit is really showpuller. As Rohit & Krrish both are contrasting, you will feel the both are different actors. Vivek Oberoi as Kaal is menacing and truly sends the chills through his devilous act. Kangana Ranaut as Kaya is very good and it's truly amongst her best. Priyanka Chopra does well in her limited appearance. All the cast has supported well. It Gets-10/10 VFX- They are stunning especially if you consider the budget. It really looks good in the theatre. There are many pacy action scenes especially the climax but they have done really nice with it, other scenes are mindblowing by bollywood standards. It Gets-9/10,(10/10 by bollywood standards & budget)

I may give the movie 9/10 but because this movie brings transition to Hindi cinema & where many are making movie in much lower budget and are getting 100,200 crores, it takes guts to take a risk of this magnitude. Hopefully it will resurrect superhero genre in India, while Krrish franchise becomes legacy for Hindi cinema.(truly out of the box) I give it a tenner (10/10) Recommendation- If you have not seen it ,the now is the time to come in terms of transitional bollywood.

review_title: Krrish 3 It's also a super hit
review_detailed_main:
Minutes before the packed preview screening of Krrish 3 in Mumbai yesterday, I felt a tap on my shoulder. A young mother with a cute 10- year-old girl in tow asked me if I thought Hrithik Roshan would show up at the screening. "I don't know, perhaps. His father's here," I replied, pointing out director Rakesh Roshan, who was standing a few feet away. The Krrish 3 director's presence didn't impress the little girl. "I only want to see Hrithik," she grumbled.

Rakesh Roshan owes the success off the Krrish series to kids like her and to be fair, he hasn't taken the fan following enjoyed by his son Hrithik and the franchise lightly. Roshan spent three years and Rs 115 crores making Krrish 3. It hopes to score with the legions of Hrithik and Priyanka Chopra fans, and as per the tried-and-trusted Bollywood mantra, the film has action, emotion and inspiration. Add to that the mysterious absence of any high profile releases for the next couple of weeks, and Krrish 3 has all the makings of a Diwali blockbuster.

In fact, do you hear that high-pitched ringing in your ears? That isn't just the sonic remains of Salim-Sulaiman's awful, background score as it bleeds out of movie theatres; it's the sound of cash registers ringing loud and clear. Seven years since the last film, Krishna Mehra alias Krrish (Hrithik) now lives in marital bliss with his wife Priya Mehra (Chopra, whose 2013 tally of Simpering Damsel In Distress is now at two, after Zanjeer), a journalist, and his mentally-challenged-yet-genius- scientist father Rohit (also Hrithik).

They live in a Mumbai that looks unusually sanitised and more dotted with ads, if such a thing were possible. Krrish 3, like its predecessors, may just be the world's greatest 'Spot The Product Placement' drinking game (chug your drink in less than 30 seconds if you spot the airplane that bears its own fictional logo as well as another existing airline's logo). The antagonist is Kaal (Vivek Oberoi), who lives in an impenetrable fortress perched upon unspecified snow-capped mountains.

He is wheelchair-bound but possesses the power to manipulate all kinds of objects with his mind, making him the love-child of Professor X and Magneto from Marvel Comics' X-Men series. Since plagiarism must never be half-baked, Kaal, who has been conducting experiments on humans for two decades to cure his handicap, also lords over his very own band of mutants, all of whose abilities have been ripped off from the X-Men universe.

They're called 'maanvars' ("Maanav + Jaanvar = Maanvar! Dude, yeh toh sorted hai!" exclaimed all six of the film's writers in unison one day, following which they all laughed, high-fived each other and treated themselves to a long lunch). One of said maanvars is Kaya (Kangna Ranaut), presumably named so for her flawless skin. Like Mystique from X-Men, she possesses the ability to assume the physical characteristics of any human being she touches. Her role is pivotal because, apart from rocking a tight latex outfit that leaves little to the imagination (not a complaint), she is the only maanvar with a speaking part and a song. The screenplay is essentially a series of developments and set-pieces inspired by many Hollywood films: Mission: Impossible 2, The Avengers, Iron Man, The Amazing Spider-Man, The Dark Knight trilogy and more. There are a couple of satisfactory original twists, but most of it is far too familiar to make any impact. The much ballyhooed special effects, touted to be a game-changer by Bollywood standards are precisely that: a game-changer only by Bollywood standards.

The sequences in Kaal's lair look pretty good, as do some shots of Krrish flying as well as general destruction; however, many others simply don't look seamless. The worst offender is an especially tacky shot of Kaya jumping off a building – it brought back fond memories of playing Tomb Raider on a Windows 98 PC. Krrish 3's flaws could have perhaps been salvaged had the dialogues and performances been at least engaging.

After all, the Iron Man franchise owes a lot to Robert Downey Jr's charisma. However, Hrithik, Priyanka and Vivek play their parts with neither wit nor charm. Add to that the hefty helpings of cheesy one- liners, expository dialogue and a thunderous, tuneless soundtrack that has been shoddily mixed to almost guarantee a headache for the viewer. But who cares? Not the lakhs of Hrithik and PC fans, like the little girl and her mum I met at the start of the show. Not the vast number who aren't bothered about Hollywood and to whom Krrish and Kaal's antics in this movie will seem original. Not those who figure it's Diwali and they have to take the family to the movies (what else is there to do?) and that's that. As for the the minority that doesn't fall into any of these categories, do you guys like drinking games?
